org.dockbox.selene.api

Interface ExceptionHelper

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimpleExceptionHelper

    public interface ExceptionHelper
    A low-level interface for easy exception handling. For all cases this should only be accessed through Selene.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T> void handleSafe(java.util.function.Consumer<T> consumer, T value)
      Runs a given consumer accepting a given value, and handles any possible exceptions using default behavior for the implementation.
      <T> void handleSafe(java.util.function.Consumer<T> consumer, T value, java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.Throwable> errorConsumer)
      Runs a given consumer accepting a given value, and handles any possible exceptions using a given consumer.
      <T,R> Exceptional<R> handleSafe(java.util.function.Function<T,R> function, T value)
      Runs a given function accepting a given value, returning a potential result wrapped in a Exceptional.
      <T,R> Exceptional<R> handleSafe(java.util.function.Function<T,R> function, T value, java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.Throwable> errorConsumer)
      Runs a given function accepting a given value, returning a potential result wrapped in a Exceptional.
      void handleSafe(java.lang.Runnable runnable)
      Runs a given runnable, and handles any possible exceptions using default behavior for the implementation.
      void handleSafe(java.lang.Runnable runnable, java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.Throwable> errorConsumer)
      Runs a given runnable, and handles any possible exceptions using a given consumer.
      void printFriendly(java.lang.String message, java.lang.Throwable exception, boolean stacktrace)
      Prints the exception in a user-friendly manner.
      void printMinimal(java.lang.String message, java.lang.Throwable exception, boolean stacktrace)
      Prints the exception in a minimal manner.

    • Method Detail

      • printFriendly

        void printFriendly(java.lang.String message,
                   java.lang.Throwable exception,
                   boolean stacktrace)
        Prints the exception in a user-friendly manner. Usually providing as much detail as possible while maintaining readability.
        Parameters:
        message - The error message provided by the developer
        exception - The exception instance
        stacktrace - Whether or not to print a stacktrace after the error information

      • printMinimal

        void printMinimal(java.lang.String message,
                  java.lang.Throwable exception,
                  boolean stacktrace)
        Prints the exception in a minimal manner. Usually providing only the bare minimum required for developers to understand what went wrong.
        Parameters:
        message - The error message provided by the developer
        exception - The exception instance
        stacktrace - Whether or not to print a stacktrace after the error information

      • handleSafe

        void handleSafe(java.lang.Runnable runnable)
        Runs a given runnable, and handles any possible exceptions using default behavior for the implementation. Usually this will be logging to a console or file.
        Parameters:
        runnable - The runnable to run

      • handleSafe

        <T> void handleSafe(java.util.function.Consumer<T> consumer,
                    T value)
        Runs a given consumer accepting a given value, and handles any possible exceptions using default behavior for the implementation. Usually this will be logging to a console or file.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of value to be consumed
        Parameters:
        consumer - The consumer to use
        value - The value to consume

      • handleSafe

        <T,R> Exceptional<R> handleSafe(java.util.function.Function<T,R> function,
                                T value)
        Runs a given function accepting a given value, returning a potential result wrapped in a Exceptional. The exceptional should wrap the exception if present. Handles any possible exceptions using default behavior for the implementation. Usually this will be logging to a console or file.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the value to be consumed
        R - The return type to be wrapped in Exceptional
        Parameters:
        function - The function to use
        value - The value to apply to
        Returns:
        The exceptional holding either the return type or an exception

      • handleSafe

        void handleSafe(java.lang.Runnable runnable,
                java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.Throwable> errorConsumer)
        Runs a given runnable, and handles any possible exceptions using a given consumer.
        Parameters:
        runnable - The runnable to run
        errorConsumer - The consumer to use for exceptions

      • handleSafe

        <T> void handleSafe(java.util.function.Consumer<T> consumer,
                    T value,
                    java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.Throwable> errorConsumer)
        Runs a given consumer accepting a given value, and handles any possible exceptions using a given consumer.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of value to be consumed
        Parameters:
        consumer - The consumer to use
        value - The value to consume
        errorConsumer - The consumer to use for exceptions

      • handleSafe

        <T,R> Exceptional<R> handleSafe(java.util.function.Function<T,R> function,
                                T value,
                                java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.Throwable> errorConsumer)
        Runs a given function accepting a given value, returning a potential result wrapped in a Exceptional. The exceptional should wrap the exception if present. Handles any possible exceptions using a given consumer.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the value to be consumed
        R - The return type to be wrapped in Exceptional
        Parameters:
        function - The function to use
        value - The value to apply to
        errorConsumer - The consumer to use for exceptions
        Returns:
        The exceptional holding either the return type or an exception
